sargaDesc: Saint Narada visits hermitage of Valmiki. Valmiki queries about a single perfect individual bestowed with all good qualities enumerated by him. Narada, knower of past, present and future, identifies such a man, describes the virtues and qualities of Sri Rama, and narrates briefly the story of his life.

shlokas.shloka: तपस्स्वाध्यायनिरतं तपस्वी वाग्विदां वरम् । नारदं परिपप्रच्छ वाल्मीकिर्मुनिपुङ्गवम् ।।
shlokas.translation: Ascetic Valmiki enquired of Narada, preeminent among the sages ever engaged in religious austerities, study of the Vedas, and best among the eloquent.

shlokas.shloka: कोन्वस्मिन्साम्प्रतं लोके गुणवान्कश्च वीर्यवान् । धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च सत्यवाक्यो दृढव्रत:।।
shlokas.translation: Who in this world lives today endowed with excellent qualities, prowess, righteousness, gratitude, truthfulness and firmness in his vows?

shlokas.shloka: चारित्रेण च को युक्तस्सर्वभूतेषु को हितः । विद्वान्क: कस्समर्थश्च कश्चैकप्रियदर्शनः ।।
shlokas.translation: Who is that one gifted with good conduct, given to the wellbeing of all living creatures, learned in the lore, capable of doing things which others cannot do and singularly handsome?

shlokas.shloka: आत्मवान्को जितक्रोधो द्युतिमान्कोऽनसूयक: । कस्य बिभ्यति देवाश्च जातरोषस्य संयुगे ।।
shlokas.translation: Who (among men) is self-restrained? Who has conquered anger? Who is endowed with brilliance and free from envy? Who is that when excited to wrath even the devatas are afraid of?

shlokas.shloka: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं परं कौतूहलं हि मे । महर्षे त्वं समर्थोऽसि ज्ञातुमेवंविधं नरम् ।।
shlokas.translation: O Maharshi, I intend to hear about such a man whom you are able to place? Indeed great is my curiosity.

shlokas.shloka: श्रुत्वा चैतत्ित्रलोकज्ञो वाल्मीकेर्नारदो वच: । श्रूयतामिति चामन्त्त्र्य प्रहृष्टो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
shlokas.translation: Invited by Valmiki to take his seat Narada, knower of the three worlds heard him and said with delight, 'Listen to me!'. And thus spoke.

shlokas.shloka: बहवो दुर्लभाश्चैव ये त्वया कीर्तिता गुणा: । मुने वक्ष्याम्यहं बुद्ध्वा तैर्युक्तश्श्रूयतान्नर: ।।
shlokas.translation: O sage rare indeed are men endowed with the many qualities you have described. I ascertained one. Listen carefully.

shlokas.shloka: इक्ष्वाकुवंशप्रभवो रामो नाम जनैश्श्रुत: । नियतात्मा महावीर्यो द्युतिमान्धृतिमान् वशी ।।
shlokas.translation: People have heard his name as Rama, who was born in the race of king Ikshvaku, having steady nature, possessing incomprehensible prowess, self-effulgent, self-commanding and subjecting senses under his control.

shlokas.shloka: बुद्धिमान्नीतिमान्वाग्मी श्रीमान् शत्रुनिबर्हण: । विपुलांसो महाबाहु: कम्बुग्रीवो महाहनु: ।।
shlokas.translation: He is a great intellectual, adherent to rules, eloquent, handsome, destroyer of foes (sins), broad-shouldered, strong-armed, having conch-shaped neck and prominent cheeks.

shlokas.shloka: महोरस्को महेष्वासो गूढजत्रुररिन्दमः । आजानुबाहुस्सुशिरास्सुललाटस्सुविक्रमः ।।
shlokas.translation: Possessing a broad chest, armed with a great bow, with fleshy collar bones, knee-long arms, a noble head, a graceful forehead and great prowess, he is the destroyer of foes.

shlokas.shloka: समस्समविभक्ताङ्गस्स्निग्धवर्ण: प्रतापवान् । पीनवक्षा विशालाक्षो लक्ष्मीवान् शुभलक्षणः ।।
shlokas.translation: Mighty and powerful, he has a well-proportioned body, neither tall nor short, shining complexion, well-developed chest, large eyes, lustrous body and good qualities.

shlokas.shloka: धर्मज्ञस्सत्यसन्धश्च प्रजानां च हिते रतः । यशस्वी ज्ञानसम्पन्नश्शुचिर्वश्यस्समाधिमान् ।।
shlokas.translation: Pious, firm in his vows, he is ever intent on doing good to his subjects. He is, illustrious, wise, and pure at heart. He is obedient to elders and ever meditating.

shlokas.shloka: प्रजापतिसमश्श्रीमान् धाता रिपुनिषूदनः । रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य धर्मस्य परिरक्षिता ।।
shlokas.translation: Auspicious like Brahma, Sri Rama is the sustainer of this world, destroyer of enemies and protector of all living beings and of the moral code.

shlokas.shloka: रक्षिता स्वस्य धर्मस्य स्वजनस्य च रक्षिता । वेदवेदाङ्गतत्त्वज्ञो धनुर्वेदे च निष्ठितः ।।
shlokas.translation: He has performed the duties of a king and protected his subjects. Knowledgeable in the true nature of the Vedas he is accomplished in military science.

words.wordEng: knower of true nature of vedas

shlokas.shloka: सर्वशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञस्स्मृतिमान्प्रतिभानवान् । सर्वलोकप्रियस्साधुरदीनात्मा विचक्षणः ।।
shlokas.translation: Sri Rama knows the true meaning of all scriptures and has a retentive memory. He is talented, beloved and well-disposed towards all people, has an unperturbed mind and is circumspect.

words.wordEng: knower of meaning of all scriptures

shlokas.shloka: सर्वदाभिगतस्सद्भिस्समुद्र इव सिन्धुभिः । आर्यस्सर्वसमश्चैव सदैकप्रियदर्शनः ।।
shlokas.translation: Sri Rama, like sea to rivers, is accessible to men of virtue and has equal disposition towards all. He always has a pleasing appearance.

shlokas.shloka: स च सर्वगुणोपेत: कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन: । समुद्र इव गाम्भीर्ये धैर्येण हिमवानिव ।।
shlokas.translation: Sri Rama, bestowed with all virtues, enhanced the joys of Kausalya, He is like the sea in deportment and like Himavant in fortitude.

shlokas.shloka: विष्णुना सदृशो वीर्ये सोमवत्प्रियदर्शनः । कालाग्निसदृशः क्रोधे क्षमया पृथिवीसमः ।। धनदेन समस्त्यागे सत्ये धर्म इवापरः ।
shlokas.translation: Sri Rama is like Visnu in prowess, the Moon in pleasing appearance, the all-consuming fire in anger, the earth in patience, Kubera in charity and the Sun in steadfastness.

shlokas.shloka: तमेवं गुणसम्पन्नं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् ।।
shlokas.translation: Thus, Sri Rama, the eldest son, was endowed with excellent virtues and true prowess.

shlokas.shloka: ज्येष्ठं श्रेष्ठगुणैर्युक्तं प्रियं दशरथस्सुतम् । प्रकृतीनां हितैर्युक्तं प्रकृतिप्रियकाम्यया । यौवराज्येन संयोक्तुमैच्छत्प्रीत्या महीपति: ।।
shlokas.translation: King Dasaratha, out of affection and a desire for the welfare of the people, wished to appoint him as Heir Apparent, who was engaged in the good of the subjects.

words.wordEng: with desire for affection of subjects
